episodes.title: The Man Trap
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters a creature that can change its appearance and feed on salt.

episodes.title: Charlie X
episodes.description: A young man with extraordinary powers is rescued by the Enterprise, but his powers lead to dangerous consequences.

episodes.title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters a barrier at the edge of the galaxy that gives two crew members god-like powers.

episodes.title: The Naked Time
episodes.description: A strange infection causes the crew to lose their inhibitions and act out their suppressed desires.

episodes.title: The Enemy Within
episodes.description: An experiment splits Captain Kirk into two beings: one representing his good side and the other his evil side.

episodes.title: Mudd's Women
episodes.description: The crew encounters Harry Mudd, a conman with three beautiful women who are more than they seem.

episodes.title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
episodes.description: The Enterprise discovers a planet where a scientist has created android duplicates of his former colleagues.

episodes.title: Miri
episodes.description: The crew discovers a planet where a disease has caused all adults to die, leaving only children who never grow up.

episodes.title: Dagger of the Mind
episodes.description: The Enterprise investigates a rehabilitation center where mind-control technology is being abused.

episodes.title: The Corbomite Maneuver
episodes.description: The Enterprise faces off against a mysterious alien ship with an unknown but potentially deadly weapon.

episodes.title: The Menagerie: Part I
episodes.description: Captain Pike, the former Enterprise captain, is kidnapped and taken to the forbidden planet Talos IV.

episodes.title: The Menagerie: Part II
episodes.description: The conclusion of the story involving Captain Pike's return to Talos IV and the truth about his current condition.

episodes.title: The Conscience of the King
episodes.description: Kirk suspects that a renowned actor may be a notorious war criminal responsible for a massacre.

episodes.title: Balance of Terror
episodes.description: The Enterprise engages in a tense game of cat-and-mouse with a Romulan ship armed with a cloaking device.

episodes.title: Shore Leave
episodes.description: The crew visits a planet where their fantasies come to life, leading to unexpected complications.

episodes.title: The Galileo Seven
episodes.description: A shuttlecraft carrying a science team crashes on a dangerous planet, and Spock must lead the crew to safety.

episodes.title: The Squire of Gothos
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters a powerful being who takes them to his private planet and plays games with their lives.

episodes.title: Arena
episodes.description: Kirk is forced to fight an alien champion in a trial by combat while the fate of the Enterprise hangs in the balance.

episodes.title: Tomorrow Is Yesterday
episodes.description: The Enterprise is sent back in time to 20th-century Earth and must avoid altering history while returning to their own time.

episodes.title: Court Martial
episodes.description: Kirk is put on trial for the death of a crew member, and must defend himself against charges of negligence.

episodes.title: The Return of the Archons
episodes.description: The Enterprise investigates a planet where the inhabitants live under the control of a mysterious computer entity.

episodes.title: Space Seed
episodes.description: The crew discovers a genetically engineered tyrant from the 20th century who attempts to take control of the Enterprise.

episodes.title: A Taste of Armageddon
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters a planet where war is waged by computer simulation, and must prevent a real war from breaking out.

episodes.title: This Side of Paradise
episodes.description: The crew encounters a planet where a plant-based organism makes people experience eternal happiness and live without conflict.

episodes.title: The Devil in the Dark
episodes.description: The Enterprise investigates a series of murders on a mining colony and discovers an intelligent, misunderstood creature.

episodes.title: Operation: Annihilate!
episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise must deal with a dangerous alien entity that is taking control of people’s minds.

episodes.title: Spock's Brain
episodes.description: Kirk and the crew face off against aliens who have stolen Spock's brain and plan to use it to control a powerful machine.

episodes.title: The Enterprise Incident
episodes.description: Kirk and the crew get involved in a secret mission to steal a Romulan cloaking device.

episodes.title: And the Children Shall Lead
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters a planet where children possess telepathic powers and manipulate adults.

episodes.title: Is There in Truth No Beauty?
episodes.description: The crew faces a challenge when they meet a blind alien ambassador with powerful psychic abilities.

episodes.title: Spectre of the Gun
episodes.description: The Enterprise crew is transported to the Wild West and must avoid disrupting a historical event while trying to return to their own time.

episodes.title: Day of the Dove
episodes.description: The Enterprise is caught in a conflict between the Klingons and the crew, manipulated by a mysterious entity.

episodes.title: For the World Is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky
episodes.description: The Enterprise discovers a living spaceship that houses an entire civilization, facing a crisis when the ship's mission is jeopardized.

episodes.title: The Tholian Web
episodes.description: Kirk and the crew are trapped in an alternate dimension and must find a way back while dealing with a hostile alien species.

episodes.title: Plato's Stepchildren
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters a planet where telekinetic aliens force the crew into submission for their entertainment.

episodes.title: Wink of an Eye
episodes.description: The Enterprise is visited by aliens with the ability to move at superhuman speeds, creating danger for the crew.

episodes.title: The Empath
episodes.description: The crew encounters a planet where a mute woman has the ability to absorb pain and heal others, putting her and the crew in danger.

episodes.title: Elaan of Troyius
episodes.description: The Enterprise is tasked with delivering a temperamental alien princess to her arranged marriage, leading to tension and conflict.

episodes.title: Whom Gods Destroy
episodes.description: Kirk and the crew must deal with a powerful, insane being who has escaped from a mental institution.

episodes.title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
episodes.description: The Enterprise becomes involved in a conflict between two aliens who are half black and half white, reflecting the racial tensions of their home planet.

episodes.title: The Mark of Gideon
episodes.description: Kirk is beamed down to a planet that seems deserted but is actually populated by an overpopulated civilization.

episodes.title: That Which Survives
episodes.description: The crew encounters a planet where a computer-generated being threatens their lives as part of a deadly game.

episodes.title: The Lights of Zetar
episodes.description: The Enterprise must deal with an energy-based lifeform that threatens the ship and one of the crew members.

episodes.title: Requiem for Methuselah
episodes.description: The crew encounters a man who claims to be the ancient Biblical figure Methuselah and has been alive for centuries.

episodes.title: The Way to Eden
episodes.description: The Enterprise crew encounters a group of space hippies searching for a mythical planet of paradise.

episodes.title: The Cloud Minders
episodes.description: The Enterprise visits a planet with a class division, where workers mine for a valuable resource while elite citizens live in luxury.

episodes.title: The Savage Curtain
episodes.description: Kirk and the crew are forced to participate in a battle against historical figures from Earth's past in a simulated arena.

episodes.title: All Our Yesterdays
episodes.description: The crew discovers a planet where time has fractured, leading them to different historical periods and causing danger.

episodes.title: Turnabout Intruder
episodes.description: Kirk’s body is taken over by a woman seeking revenge, causing chaos aboard the Enterprise.

films.title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
films.description: The crew of the Enterprise must save Earth from an alien spacecraft of enormous power.

films.title: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan
films.description: Admiral Kirk faces his old foe, Khan Noonien Singh, who seeks revenge against him and the Federation.

films.title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
films.description: Kirk and his crew must recover the stolen Enterprise and search for Spock, who has been resurrected on the planet Genesis.

films.title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home
films.description: The crew travels back in time to 20th-century Earth to save the planet from an alien probe.

films.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier
films.description: Kirk and the crew confront a rogue Vulcan who has taken control of the Enterprise in search of the mythical planet Sha Ka Ree.

films.title: Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country
films.description: Kirk and his crew are sent to negotiate peace with the Klingons, but find themselves embroiled in a conspiracy.
